inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getPatchBaseline.

defaultBaseline.description: Filters the results against the baselines default_baseline field.

namePrefix.description: Filter results by the baseline name prefix.

operatingSystem.description: Specified OS for the baseline. Valid values: `AMAZON_LINUX`, `AMAZON_LINUX_2`, `UBUNTU`, `REDHAT_ENTERPRISE_LINUX`, `SUSE`, `CENTOS`, `ORACLE_LINUX`, `DEBIAN`, `MACOS`, `RASPBIAN` and `ROCKY_LINUX`.

owner.description: Owner of the baseline. Valid values: `All`, `AWS`, `Self` (the current account).

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getPatchBaseline.

approvalRules.description: List of rules used to include patches in the baseline.

approvedPatches.description: List of explicitly approved patches for the baseline.

approvedPatchesComplianceLevel.description: The compliance level for approved patches.

approvedPatchesEnableNonSecurity.description: Indicates whether the list of approved patches includes non-security updates that should be applied to the instances.

globalFilters.description: Set of global filters used to exclude patches from the baseline.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

name.description: The name specified to identify the patch source.

rejectedPatchesAction.description: The action specified to take on patches included in the `rejected_patches` list.

sources.description: Information about the patches to use to update the managed nodes, including target operating systems and source repositories.
